title: Photoshop design question
content:
I have a photograph of a hydrangea head that I am trying to create to look like the ones in the stationery below. I am using Photoshop 7.0. Does anyone have instructions on how to do this or links to online tutorials?   
 ![Hydrangea invite](http://web.archive.org/web/20131018220356im_/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/messages/4100/36158.jpg) ![hydrangea invite_2](http://web.archive.org/web/20131018220356im_/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/messages/4100/36159.jpg)
author: aspst22

comments.content: How good is the photo? Silhouette the flower, put the image on its own layer and put a rectangular marque around the photo and make it into a brush. Pick a PMS color and use your newly created brush and paint.

I think you're looking to emulate the illustrated etching of the illustrations in your sample, right?   
   
If so, you should check out the Andromeda Filters, which do a decent job of changing photos to faux-etched illustration.   
   
 [http://www.andromeda.com/info/series3.html](http://web.archive.org/web/20131018220356/http:/www.andromeda.com/info/series3.html)
